text: William Henry Luers (May 15, 1929 â€“ May 10, 2025) was an American career diplomat and museum executive. He was the director of the Iran Project. In addition to a thirty-one-year career in the Foreign Service, Luers served as a U.S. Navy officer, as president of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City, and as president of the United Nations Association of the United States of America. Luers was an adjunct professor at the School of International and Public Affairs at Columbia University. He died on May 10, 2025, five days before his 96th birthday.
title: William Luers
